intro: Cypella glauca, commonly known as the silverleaf cypella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are covered in a fine, silvery-white layer of hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cypella glauca is often found in rocky soils and is known for its resilience in harsh climates.
